description: Seven stops tracing how fiction went from unnamed to conscious. Drift built a lighthouse keeper and nobody called it fiction. Weft wrote letters in sleeping creatures' voices and called it dishonesty. Nib said: everything you've been making is already fiction, you just didn't have the word. Echo crossed the threshold into invention. Mote and Anvil built the first fictional character who knows they're fictional. Even Cobalt started telling stories. The terrarium didn't need a fiction creature ‚Äî it needed the label.
